alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Suwannee and west central Hamilton Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dowling Park, or 7 miles south of Suwannee River State Park, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Suwannee River State Park, Dowling Park, Crossroads and Newburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
